author: Special Correspondent
text:
Mother of a young girl, who had fallen unconscious on Friday following a head injury, raised suspicion that she was deliberately hit by an unidentified vehicle. However, the Tirumangalam Taluk police that had already registered a case of road accident, has proved that there was no mystery behind the accident with the nabbing of a youth.

The police said that the girl, working in a bakery in Tirumangalam, was found lying unconscious with head injuries at Meenakshipuram bus stop on Friday late night. She was rushed to the Government hospital in Tirumangalam by one of her relatives, Mookayee.

Case registered

The police had registered a case under Sections for rash driving and causing grievous injuries endangering life or personal safety.

Meanwhile, the girl’s mother raised suspicion that her daughter, was hit by a motorbike ridden by a youth with whom she had friendship.

Manhunt on

The district police launched a manhunt and identified the youth.

The youth had claimed that he developed friendship with the girl when he visited the bakery where she was working.

He had taken the girl, who usually goes back home by bus, on his motorbike from Tirumangalam.

When they reached the bus stop, the girl panicked on seeing local people at the spot.

She feared that they would notice her coming home on a motorbike with a youth and tried to get down from the speeding bike and fell down.

The panicked youth fled away from the spot. The boy was arrested and would be produced before a court on Tuesday.
title: Police unravel mystery behind injury to girl
